ray.background

Interface Background

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Cubemap, Uniform

    public interface Background
    A background is responsible for assigning radiances to rays that don't hit any geometry. This interface has the standard form for a function that can be importance sampled. It could be extended to allow for stratification or to give the sampling code access to some information about the shading point to enable better sampling methods.
    Author:
    srm

      • evaluate

        void evaluate(Vector3 direction,
              Color outRadiance)
        Find the background radiance.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction in which we are looking
        outRadiance - The radiance seen in that direction

      • generate

        void generate(Point2 seed,
              Vector3 outDirection)
        Generate a sample from a distribution suitable for importance sampling this background.
        Parameters:
        seed - A random point in the unit square
        outDirection - The chosen direction direction

      • pdf

        double pdf(Vector3 direction)
        Evaluate the pdf used by generate().
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction in question
        Returns:
        The pdf of generate() choosing direction
